name: JavaScript
description: Hands-on JavaScript coding problem statements covering fundamentals, DOM, async behavior, and real-world use cases.

topics.name: JavaScript Basics
questions: Print 'Hello, World!' to the console.
Take two numbers as input and print their sum.
Check whether a number is even or odd.
Find the largest of three numbers.
Swap two variables without using a third variable.

topics.name: Operators & Conditions
questions: Check if a number is positive, negative, or zero.
Determine pass or fail based on marks.
Check if a year is a leap year.
Check whether a character is a vowel or consonant.
Validate login credentials using if-else.

topics.name: Loops
questions: Print numbers from 1 to 10 using a for loop.
Print numbers from 10 to 1 using a while loop.
Print all even numbers between 1 and 50.
Find the factorial of a number.
Generate the Fibonacci series up to N terms.

topics.name: Functions
questions: Create a function to add two numbers.
Write a function to check whether a number is prime.
Return multiple values from a function.
Use an arrow function to calculate the square of a number.
Create a recursive function to find factorial.

topics.name: Arrays
questions: Find the sum of elements in an array.
Find the largest and smallest elements in an array.
Remove duplicate elements from an array.
Reverse an array without using built-in methods.
Sort an array in ascending order.

topics.name: Strings
questions: Reverse a string.
Check whether a string is a palindrome.
Count the number of vowels in a string.
Find the frequency of each character in a string.
Check if two strings are anagrams.

topics.name: Objects
questions: Create an object to store student details.
Access and update object properties.
Loop through object keys and values.
Merge two objects.
Convert an object into an array of keys and values.

topics.name: DOM Manipulation
questions: Change the text of an element using JavaScript.
Change the background color of a div on button click.
Create and append a new element to the DOM.
Remove an element from the DOM.
Toggle a class on an element.

topics.name: Events
questions: Handle a button click event.
Display input value on keyup event.
Change an image on mouse hover.
Create a simple counter using click events.
Prevent form submission using JavaScript.

topics.name: Asynchronous JavaScript
questions: Create a timeout using setTimeout.
Create an interval using setInterval.
Fetch data from an API using fetch.
Handle promises using then and catch.
Rewrite a promise-based code using async and await.

topics.name: Error Handling
questions: Handle errors using try and catch.
Throw a custom error.
Validate user input with error handling.
Handle API errors gracefully.
Create a fallback message when an error occurs.

topics.name: Mini Projects (JavaScript)
questions: Build a calculator using HTML, CSS, and JavaScript.
Create a to-do list with add and delete functionality.
Build a quiz application using JavaScript.
Create a digital clock using JavaScript.
Build a simple image slider.
